hypothesis_content.title: Negative Funding Catalyst Momentum Flip
hypothesis_content.statement: During a neutral/bear regime, if perpetual swap funding rates turn deeply negative (< -0.03% per 8hr) while price is in a downtrend, a short-squeeze catalyst (e.g., positive news headline) will trigger an amplified reversal rally that retraces 50-61.8% of the prior 3-day decline.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Deep negative funding indicates extreme short positioning and leverage. The market is primed for a squeeze. A catalyst acts as a spark, forcing shorts to cover. This covering creates reflexive buying pressure, amplifying the initial catalyst move beyond its intrinsic news value. The Fibonacci target is a common technical magnet for counter-trend moves.
entry_conditions: Catalyst trigger: Positive news sentiment spike (headline API score > 0.6) OR 5-minute price surge > 1.5% on high volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: New low below the pre-catalyst 3-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Negative funding persists and price continues down despite catalyst, or reversal fails to exceed 38.2% retracement.
